name: TUFF CREW BAND REMEMBER ?
description: Unreleased 90's EP from Tuff Crew! The title of this EP, 'Remember?' comes from the classic Billboard track 'My Part Of Town' from their 1988 album 'Danger Zone'. Solid Ground Records, along with Tone Love & Ice Dog have compiled 6 unreleased songs from the Tuff Crew archive, and will be the 1st installment of unreleased material from the legendary Philly crew. Selling more than 7 million records worldwide to date, Tuff Crew is offering these songs in a limited edition 12" EP. Limited to 300 copies

name: REBEL MUSIC
description:
Finishing off the year 2010, Poison Ladd S.L.R. – Beats In General return with another vintage 12” Ep of un-released songs recorded between 1992 -1996. These recordings was pulled from the countless Dat tapes from Beats In General’s archives. REBEL MUSIC. Includes “All The Hits & More” (1992) a song about  a drug addicts addiction to crack cocaine, “No Fast Food Job” which details the harsh realities of working at a places like mc’donalds in 1993, Cypress Hill Inspired “One On Da Shelf” (1993) speaks about dealing with untrust worthy
people in the hood, & “Bourbon & Bullets” (1996) story telling at its best whichincludes names of brand liquors & cigarettes.

artists.name: Poison Ladd S.L.R. - Beats In General

name: GHETTO SOLDIERS
description: Mc Googly – Aka – William Daniels ("The Public Enemy Of Philly") born and raised in Philadelphia, Pa. (North Philly) in 1967, moved to The logan section of Philadelphia in 1980, where he first witnessed hip hop at its finest. We’re talking 2 Turntables and a microphone. Well known Dj’s like Disco Rat, Disco Poo Sex Machine, would be off the hook with performances, with rappers, and rap groups. His study of the rap game had him rapping at the early age of 13 sounding just as good as the older rappers. In 1983 he met Ronald Potts known then as Mc Rockwell (aka) Poison Ladd at Olney Highschool in Philadelphia where the challenge each other  to take there skills to the next level. Shortly after,  they met Wayne Rhoads know then as Big which they later named Extortionist B (aka) Beats In General  and they formed a group (Boys Of Doom) they produced a sound that still today is ringing in the public ear. They were considered one of the hottest groups in philly at that time, but still no shine in 1984. In 1987 the Boys Of Doom had to part due to Mc Googly’s  incarceration which he did  a 2 year sentence. His incarceration helped him perfect his rap skills,  Mc Googly returned to the group B.O.D. in 1989 and recorded several  solo songs  but violated his parole and returned right back to prison until 1992. By then B.O.D. was no more, and Ronald Potts, & Wayne Rhoads became Poison Ladd S.L.R. – Beats In General., so Mc Googly moved on as a solo artist recording various hip hop songs throughout the 90’s. We hope you enjoy the many lost treasures of Mc Googly, One of the illest Mc’s of philly.

name: BLACK PUSSY / RED WAGON
description: another classic  unreleased 12” single, Black Pussy 1994 / Red Wagon 1993 & bonus verse Yo - Yo - Yo! “Black Pussy ” is Poison Ladd view of the explicit encounters of a promiscuous black woman. Deemed way too explicit for the mainstream, this song was also never released.

artists.name: Poison Ladd S.L.R. - Beats In General

name: THING CALLED JAZZ / WHO'S THE MAN
description:
Embarking in the Random Rap Craze 
phenomenon, Solid Ground's Re-issue 
of Poison Ladd S.L.R. - Beats In General
Still Another 1-4-U-2-N-V 12" LP has 
catapulted a wave of unreleased material
of Poison Ladd recorded between the 
years of 1985-1998. The first installment
of these limited rare recordings is the 
highly anticipated Poison Ladd S.L.R. - 
Thing Called Jazz / Who's The Man 12"
Single which features production from 
Beats In General, and 100X's producer 
L.E. Square. The A Side - Thing Called Jazz
recorded in 1989(produced by: Beats In General)
combines rythmatic drum, bass, & horn samples with Poison Ladd's homage to jazz musicians. Thing Called jazz has recieved great reviews and is 
highly sought after by fans, & collectors all over the world. The B Side - Who's The Man(produced by:
 L.E. Square) also features a jazz style beat with a edgier feel known by 100X's L.E. Sqaure, and
displays Poison Ladd's many styles. Although these 2 tracks were recorded almost 8 years apart, 
they both compliment each other for this release.

artists.name: Poison Ladd S.L.R. - Beats In General
